content: beginner pumpkin decorations size depending on yarn size ~ 3 tall x 12 circumference ~ 50 yds #4 medium weight yarn knitting needles size us 8 5mm yarn needle for sewing in ends small amount of stuffing a small cinnamon stick or found stick glue gauge is not important for this pattern pattern notes the only stitches used in this pattern are the knit stitch and the purl stitch the pumpkin is knit flat and then stitches are gathered on one end sewn up the side and stuffed and then beginning stitches are gathered and secured to achieve the look of a pumpkin the stick is then glued into place to finish copyright ©2021 donielle a showvay for knitting knicely all rights reserved the knitting coach page 1 cast on 37 sts using the long tail cast on method row 1 k1 p6 x5 k2 row 2 k1 p1 k6 x5 k1 repeat row 1 and 2 until piece measures 5 cut yarn leaving a tail one yard long using tapestry needle thread yarn through all live stitches on knitting needle thread yarn through all live stitches once again and pull tight using mattress stitch sew the two sides together forming a cup shape stuff the pumpkin with the stuffing use a generous amount of stuffing if you want your pumpkin nice and plump using the tapestry needle again thread tail through all beginning stitches going around twice pull tight to form a ball in order to form the pumpkin shape pull yarn from the top of the pumpkin to the bottom and around the outside five times pulling the yarn slightly tight into the purl stitch grooves to create the scallop sections of the pumpkin secure yarn by first tying to the beginning tail yarn and then pushing yarn to center of pumpkin by threading onto the tapestry needle and out the side cut yarn close to the outside of the pumpkin glue the stick to the top of your pumpkin and let dry congratulations and enjoy your cute little pumpkin decorations please feel free to sell any of the items you make from my pattern but do not copy distribute share or sell pattern
